intro: Anemonospermos angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf anemonospermos, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant features delicate, upright stems with trifoliate leaves that are narrow and serrated. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
